result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A Harmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Timothy A Harmon in court by video conferencing with attorney Marcella De Peters in court.  Defendant Timothy A Harmon in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
In court for Restitution hearing. Arguments heard. Sworn and testified: Defendant.    Court orders restitution in the amount of $15,000 awarded to State Crime Victim Compensation Fund. 
  
As to payment of restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Timothy A Harmon not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for restitution hearing today.  Defendant was prepared to appear by video today.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing.  Additionally, State cannot locate file.  Hearing adjourned.  New date selected with video conferencing technician, institution and counsel.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (43 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 7, 2016 received and filed.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Timothy A Harmon not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for restitution hearing today.  Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Defendant was to appear by video conferencing today.  Court orders matter adjourned.  Defendant to appear by video on next date.  Video conferencing technician is notified.  Restitution hearing adjourned to 3/2/17 at 8:30am in Br. 35.
- dated 12/6/16 from State of Wisconsin Department of Justice re: Crime Victim Compensation Program application, filed with attachment.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Timothy A Harmon not in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for restitution hearing.  State provides additional documentation to defense today.  Court orders hearing adjourned.  Defendant to appear by video on next date, video conferencing technician notified.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Video conferencing technician is not available for 8:30am hearing.  Restitution hearing time changed to 10:00 on 12/7/16.  Counsel notified.
- filed.

Defendant Timothy A Harmon in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Timothy A Harmon in custody.  Student Intern Michelle Alexander under the supervision of Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Court briefly passes case.  Case continues on the record.  Court hears statement of victim, Rashaad A. (by phone).  Sentencing hearing continues.   

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court WAIVIES DNA surcharge due to offense date proceeding current DNA requirement.  
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and restitution (if ordered).  Court orders matter scheduled for restitution hearing.       
As to all costs, surcharges and restitution, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Restitution hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Court authorizes defendant's appearance by video for restitution hearing.    

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST as to AMENDED COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Matter to proceed to sentencing at 1:30pm today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy A Harmon in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Timothy A Harmon in custody.  Michelle Alexander appears under the student practice rules and supervised by Denis John Stingl for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is scheduled for jury trial today.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Case is called on the record.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty.  Court ordered COUNT 1 amended to Second Degree Reckless Injury, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 94.23(2)(a), a Class F Felony.  Counsel advises defendant wishes to enter a plea as to amended charge.

Defendant Timothy A Harmon in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Timothy A Harmon in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Court conducts conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  State requests case be passed, State to check witness availability.    

Matter is recalled.  State states they are able to proceed.  Court will proceed to speedy trial in another matter.  Court orders trial adjourned due to calendar congestion.  Court will allow NO FURTHER ADJOURNMENTS of the trial date in this case.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Timothy A Harmon in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Timothy A Harmon in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 All parties in receipt of second report. No corrections or additions. All parties in agreement with the findings.   All parties review the doctor's report.  State and Defense do not challenge the report.  The Court found defendant DOES LACK THE COMPACITY TO UNDERSTAND COURT PROCEEDINGS.     Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review on 1-21-15  at 8:30, Branch 47.
  Review hearing scheduled for 01-21-2015 at 08:30 am.
